snippet: Police officers who fired 12 shots at Darrius H. Kennedy did what they were trained to do, city officials and experts on police procedure said.
abstract: City officials and experts on police procedure say that New York City police officers did what they were trained to do in the fatal shooting of a knife-wielding man near Times Square; two officers fired 12 shots at Darrius H Kennedy, after he ignored their orders to drop the long kitchen knife he was waving around and pepper spray failed to stop him; at least seven of the bullets hit Kennedy, including three shots to the chest.

byline.contributor: Wendy Ruderman, Michael Schwirtz and Kate Taylor contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Police officers who fired 12 shots at Darrius H. Kennedy did what they were trained to do, city officials and experts on police procedure said.

headline.seo: New York Police Followed Training in Fatal Shooting Near Times Square, Officials Said
headline.main: Officials Defend Fatal Shooting of a Knife-Wielding Man Near Times Sq.
headline.print_headline: Officials Defend Fatal Shooting of a Knife-Wielding Man Near Times Sq.
